definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
classifier for gifts, newspaper, magazine, papers, reports, contracts etc/variant of 分[fen4]

sentences.english: But usually in January you can't do it because it's too cold.
sentences.chinese: 但通常在一月份不能做，因为太冷了。

sentences.english: The long-haired OA-Puss will celebrate her 24th birthday in January — much to the  astonishment of Quentin Shaw, who has owned her since 1987.
sentences.chinese: 这只长毛猫猫，即将在一月份迎来自己的24岁生日。

sentences.english: The curriculum centred on the extra class of winter vacation in January.
sentences.chinese: 一月份的课程集中在寒假的加课上。

sentences.english: He conked out in November with pleurisy.
sentences.chinese: 他患肋膜炎于十一月份死去。

sentences.english: Mayday's first performance in November came off very well.
sentences.chinese: 五月天十一月份的首场演出非常成功。

sentences.english: The team will return to India to continue studying Koro in November.
sentences.chinese: 这支探险队会在十一月份回到印度继续研究珂珞语。

sentences.english: The incidents follow a similar one in January that killed another top nuclear scientist.
sentences.chinese: 这些事件按照一月份的杀了一个类似的首席核科学家。

sentences.english: This week, lunette carrera, he subscribed a announcement authorising a presidential referendum in January.
sentences.chinese: 本周，他签署了一个声明授权于一月份的总统选举。

sentences.english: It's at the end of January or the beginning of February. It marks the beginning of the lunar year.
sentences.chinese: 春节在一月份或二月初，标志着农历年的开始。

sentences.english: In January it broke out into muting.
sentences.chinese: 到了一月份，就爆发成为兵变。

sentences.english: In January the foreign ministry was caught off-guard by the army's test of an anti-satellite weapon.
sentences.chinese: 一月份外交部才被军方的反卫星武器实验摆了一道。

sentences.english: The study is detailed in the January issue of the journal Ethology.
sentences.chinese: 这份研究在一月份的动物行为学期刊内有详细的说明。

sentences.english: Unlike in the UK, the Australian school year begins in January.
sentences.chinese: 与英国不同，澳大利亚每年都在一月份开学。

sentences.english: Churchills were also in town; and they were only waiting for November.
sentences.chinese: 两位邱吉尔先生也在伦敦，只等着十一月份来临。

sentences.english: The weather isn't half-bad , considering it's January .
sentences.chinese: 这样的天气在一月份就算不错了。

definition: start of month/early in the month
